snippet: Retailers must give shoppers a chance to opt out of being tracked in physical stores.
abstract: Editorial criticizes retailers of physical stores for tracking shoppers, using security cameras and devices that can monitor location of customer cellphones, without informing them; argues stores, in order not to alienate customers, need to tell the public what they are doing and give people the ability to opt out of monitoring.
lead_paragraph: Retailers must give shoppers a chance to opt out of being tracked in physical stores.

headline.main: You (and Your Cellphone) on Candid Camera
